query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

warnings.message: One of the fields on which a sort was requested does not exist

result.title: Final Impact Assessment Report on TRL advances on KPIs
result.description: This deliverable provides a Final Report on KPIs and benchmarking and will provide numerical estimates of significant KPI improvements and the impact on production the environment fish welfare

result.title: Consumer perception –Greece
result.description: The report will focus on description of perception, purchasing habits and preferences of Greek consumers towards seabass and seabream products. The deliverable D5.10 will provide the integral part for the following tasks in the formation of the marketing plan and strategies for seabass and seabream products on the Greek market.

result.title: PerformFISH Dissemination and Exploitation Plan
result.description: A draft Dissemination and Exploitation Plan (DEP) will be finalised early in the project, and validated by the partnership. It will adopt EC best practice communication guideline principles and define the objectives, target end-users, planned tools and channels, responsibilities, resources and metrics for measuring impact. On an annual basis, the plan will be evaluated for effectiveness and adjusted if needed, following inputs from the partnership and consortium bodies.

result.title: Estimation of genetic parameters for several growth and/or morphometric traits and comparison of the EBVs under different models
result.description: Analyze the variance of the morphometric trajectories to validate the opportunity to perform early selection on morphology reduce cost of breeding programs and Evaluate that the estimated genetic parameters and breeding values obtained from a random regression model are equivalent and in certain instances identical to those obtained from multivariate models

result.title: Genetic architecture of morphological abnormalities trait in gilthead seabream
result.description: Study and locate the main genetic factors acting along development in gilthead seabream by sampling from early stages until harvesting Analyze in a flashback mode until a marker can be used as predictive of the deformity The above markers could be correlated with the low cost markers of WP2 to validate their true utility

result.title: SNP-chip tool validation
result.description: - SNP mining will be performed from NGS data that will provide high coverage of each individual genome, - Validation of the SNP-chip tool in a wide range of source populations to evaluate genotyping efficiency, - The development of a SNP-chip in those two species will lead to higher selection accuracies.

result.title: Global genomic evaluation methods (GBLUP) and Genome Wide Association Analysis (GWAS) using the SNP tool
result.description: Seabass from one of the two parasitic challenges will be genotyped with the SNP tool parasitic challenge Perform all steps of genotypes control GWAS and estimation of genomic breeding values GEBVs and their accuracy compared to classic polygenic EBV ranking comparisons The choice of the methodology for the estimation of GEBVs will be based on the simulation results

result.title: Feeding Technology Field validation report
result.description: Report of the field validation of formulations technology and feeding management obtained in WP4 in field trials in sea bass and sea bream populations The report will combine validation data of the feeding technology applications to improve knowledge on biomass estimation and feeding behavioral patterns

result.title: Main Report on USA Market
result.description: The report will provide description of the structure of the US market for seabass and seabream products The main elements of the analysis will include evaluation of the market conditions products supply chain overview of trade and existing market activities for seabass and seabream products in the USA In addition availability of seabass and seabream products in the US retail and HoReCa and expected market development will constitute an important part of the deliverable D57 representing a necessary background for understanding of market conditions

result.title: Certificate of quality
result.description: Hatchery monitoring guidelines identifying the acceptable quality range of juveniles with selected critical markers identified in D22 D24 that are well correlated with egg larvae and juvenile quality A workshop between RDI and Aquaculture Associations to develop the selfassessment certification concept A working document for selfassessment certification by industry that will include a framework document integrating production regime and presenting favourable and developmental trajectories and unfavourable trajectories for a restricted set of parameters established as strongly predictive of quality through 21 and 22

result.title: Diagnostics methods for Mediterranean farmed fish
result.description: A practical diagnostic procedure guide of recommended diagnostic techniques for the most relevant diseases affecting Mediterranean Sea bream and seabass will be produced. This guide will include also a description of the state of the art on diagnostic techniques and also will present new developments achieved in task 3.4.2. This guide will follow the basic structure of the OIE manual for aquatic animal diseases but will be presented in an electronic and more dynamic way.
